label: 本地乗迹
本: Capital and Countryside in Japan, 300-1180:  Japanese Historians Interpreted in English . Cornell University East Asia Program . 2006
説明文: a religious teaching to the effect that Japan’s deities (kami) are manifestations (suijaku) of Buddhas or bodhisattvas, the latter representing their true forms (honji). [神] [垂迹] [本地]
